data.title: Tsgt. Jay Garnett Merrick, Usaf (Ret.) Obituary 2017
data.meta_description: Jay Merrick, 82, passed away on Thursday, August 10, 2017.Jay was born on October 11, 1934 in Albany, New York to the late Jay and Bernice Moore Merrick. A proud Vietnam Veteran...
data.text:
Jay Merrick, 82, passed away on Thursday, August 10, 2017.

Jay was born on October 11, 1934 in Albany, New York to the late Jay and Bernice Moore Merrick. A proud Vietnam Veteran, he served his country in the United States Air Force for twenty years. Jay loved to travel; he traveled the entire United States and had been on seventy-two cruises during his lifetime. As much as he enjoyed traveling, his greatest joy came from time spent with his beloved family.

Along with his parents, his son, Gary W. Palfrey, preceded him in death.

His memory will forever be treasured by his loving wife of 52 years, Shirley Merrick of Kathleen; sons, Richard C. Palfrey (Darlene) of Bonaire, Phillip L. Palfrey (Exie) of Acworth; grandchildren, Jason Palfrey, Niki Palfrey, Ann Marie Mays, Matthew Palfrey, Kelley Anne Palfrey; great-grandchildren, Taylor Palfrey, Tyler Palfrey, Kaylee Tucker, Landon Tucker, Jordyn Bostian, Holden Mays, Jasper Mays, Bryson Tompkins, Westin Tompkins, and sister, Janet Ruth Clark of New York.

Visitation will be Tuesday, August 15, 2017 from 10:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m. at McCullough Funeral Home. A funeral service will immediately follow at 11:00 a.m. in the Chapel of McCullough. After the service, Jay will be laid to rest in Parkway Memorial Gardens with full military honors.

To order memorial trees or send flowers to the family in memory of Tsgt. Jay Garnett Merrick, Usaf (Ret.), please visit our flower store.
